pros: Friendly with welcoming as employees volunteer and great business aspects for employees. Very supportive.
cons: No there's no bad about this business.

pros: Lovely people Hybrid working Good values
cons: Short lunch break Treatment of residents
Wages were low and hours long

pros: Clients (although some were not encouraged to be independant)
cons: Poor management; there is certainly a huge divide between those working with clients and those in the offices.

job_title: Customer Services Assistant in Swindon, Wiltshire, South West England, England
pros: Great people. Reliable hours. Excellent opportunity
cons: I have nothing negative about Enham.

pros: It was great to be able to work on site with many of the beneficiaries of the charity. They were extremely welcoming. There are some very committed members of staff who have kept Enham Trust going and always put the clients first.
cons:
The senior management team are very poor at communicating with the rest of the organisation. They are blissfully unaware of what it is like for those working on the ground. Staff struggle to be motivated when expectations are so wildly unrealistic. 
Mostly staff work very hard but there are some individuals who add nothing to the organisation and have a negative impact on other staff.

review_title: The most rewarding place to be
pros: the most rewarding thing is when you do something so simple for a client and they then tell you that you have made their life so much easier, I have a great relationship with clients even though we may only talk on the phone, we are their lifeline and I love my work
cons: It breaks my heart when we hear a client has passed away, we know it may happen as some are receiving end of life care, but it is still heart wrenching when it happens.

job_title: Expert By Experience in Saint Leonards, South East England, England
pros: Polite, caring, supportive, welcoming, constant communication, If they are not available at the time they will contact you asap. I have only recently joined Enham Trust but I am very happy working for them, they are very supportive and they are always willing to help if you have any problems at all.
cons: The only downside I can think of is mine; as I don't drive it makes it difficult for me to get to any venues that are in a remote area. However Enham have been very accommodating in giving me Telephone research instead.

pros: Amazing sense of community in and around Enham. Everyone is welcoming and are all there for the same purpose, to support and help disabilities and independence in their lives. Never had a day where no one is smiling. I love working for Enham and am so lucky to have the opportunity to be a part of such a great place.
cons: I can not think of anything that I don't like about working for Enham. Every day is a good day!

pros:
- Supportive colleagues.
- Suggestions are taken on board and actioned the best they can be. 
- Motivates me to do my best.
cons:
- Dealing with difficult individuals.
- The location can make you feel a little separated from the charity head office itself.

pros: Open and friendly atmosphere. Kind, passionate front line staff
cons: Wrong people in leadership. Incompetent and driven by personal agendas, no real personal passion for charity or disability rights.

pros: friendly, facilities are good, and the people that use the service are involved in activities, have friendships that are long standing.
cons: i travel a bit of a way to get here

pros: Friendly and helpful colleagues at head office.
cons: Staff from other offices often overlooked
